programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 6, Episode 34:

The "Gabrielle Chanel, fashion manifesto" exhibition at the Palais Galliera in Paris. Everything you need to know about the colour yellow and sleeveless sweaters. Plab Grand Est preserves the tradition of furniture and seating "made in" Liffol-le-Grand. The MaisonCléo brand, or the story of a seamstress mother and designer daughter.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.sub-title: Il était une fois dans l'Ouest - 1re partie
programme.desc: Once upon a time in the West - Part 1 Guided by Michelle Bouffard, Christian heads for Western Canada for two programmes from the Okanagan Valley. We begin by visiting Kelowna, home to the first vineyards in this part of the country. Presenter: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: La vigne est belle
programme.desc:
The harvests
It's time for the harvests and festivities as a family or among friends and colleagues. Everyone's happy at harvest time: at Pigeon Hill, Nival, L'Orpailleur, Bergeville, Négondos, Lieux Communs, Château de Cartes, St-Jacques and La Bauge, the vines are heavy with fruit.
Director: Pascal Brouard (Canada, 2022)

programme.title: Les nouveaux nomades
programme.desc: We explore the Massif du Pilat and its breathtaking panoramas; then discover Laval, European capital of virtual reality, and Sainte-Agnès, for an encounter with a glass specialist; explore the craze for over-sized teddy bears in Paris and the profession of fish farmer in the Îles Sanguinaires. Presented by: Laurent Guillaume, Julie Hattu, Nathalie Simon, Yvan Hallouin, Célia Petroni.

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.sub-title: Les Cévennes
programme.desc: The Cévennes Deep in the Cévennes mountain range, Kevin Soulié takes us behind the scenes to look at spirulina and sweet onion farming in the region, Sophie Moreau makes cheese and yoghurt with sheep's milk, and Marie-Pierre Puech welcomes us to their wildlife hospital. Presenter: Guy Martin.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.sub-title: Les métiers d'art/Simone Pheulpin
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #VF
programme.sub-title: Le bronze
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Passe-moi les jumelles
programme.desc:
Former machine designer, Marcel enchants his everyday by making wooden toys that accumulate in his loft, veritable Aladdin's cave. With a passion for wine, Johanna Dayer is the first Swiss woman to, hopefully, become a Master of Wine. A fabulous adventure for one who advocates an agriculture close to nature.
Presented by: Matthieu Fournier.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Salade de fenouil et pâtes aux tomates
programme.desc: Fennel salad and pasta with tomatoes Pasquale Vari presents a starter with fennel, prawns, lemon and fleur de sel, together with a simple pasta dish that makes life easy when you have guests. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Thalassa
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Mégastructures romaines en Gaule
programme.desc:
In the heart of ancient Paris
With its 2,185 monuments, Paris is a world tourism capital. The City of Light also shelters ruins that bear witness to the Gallo-Roman period: a few metres from Place Monge, the Arena of Lutetia is amongst the oldest remains from these ancient times, along with the Cluny thermal baths.
Directed by: Fabrice Buysschaert (France, 2021)

programme.title: Ô la belle vie
programme.desc: Meyrueis, a visionary village In the Jonte Gorges and at the foot of Mont Aigoual, Meyrueis is where the Causses meet the Cévennes. A wild unspoilt valley where villages are rare. Meyrueis itself is home to only 800 inhabitants for a surface area equivalent to that of Paris. Presented by: Sophie Jovillard.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.sub-title: La nature qui change des vies
programme.desc: When nature changes lives An encounter with Thérèse Homassel and her passion for cactus. A new generation working to protect the environment. A bucolic visit to a high-perched garden in the Perche. Valérie and Julien call on Stéphane's skills to distract the eye from the immense wall bordering their garden and create low-maintenance borders. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: Pistes vertes
programme.sub-title: Éboueur de rivière/Maraîcher bio/Café éco responsable/Marais des communaux
programme.desc: On his inflatable kayak, Pierre Dubourg collects rubbish floating on the Orne, in Caen. Visit of the school garden in Tollevast, in Cotentin, with an organic fruit and vegetable grower. At La Roche d'Oëtre, Morgane and her companion manage an eco-responsible restaurant. Walk in the valley of the Andelle. Presenter: Laurent Quembre.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: We head to the Army Museum for a strictly "defensive" visit. Furniture, rugs, objects: Alexia Leleu brings her family history to life. Balenciaga breaks all the rules, freeing fashion from its inhibitions. A journey through time with Les Vertugadins, a design studio creating period costumes. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La main à la pâte
programme.desc: Lamb from southern Manitoba Guy and Leah met just a few kilometres from Manitoba's American border. They got married and had lots of little lambs... As well as two boys. In their company, Luc learns more about lamb. Presenter: Luc Jean.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.sub-title: Stéphane Rolland/L'élastique/La jupe longue
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Varsovie (Pologne) Découverte des halles de Varsovie. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

Presented by: Matthieu Fournier.

programme.title: La recette de Guy Martin
programme.sub-title: Tartare de veau
programme.desc: Veal tartar with oysters and seaweed, warm bread roll The Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin presents products emblematic of France and suggests a recipe to prepare them. Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: La recette de Guy Martin
programme.sub-title: Rouleau de volaille aux truffes
programme.desc: Rolled chicken with truffles, green apples and confit lemon The Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin presents products emblematic of France and suggests a recipe to prepare them. Presented by: Guy Martin.
